meanings.sent1: The quinic taste of the medicine was bitter.
meanings.sent2: She studied the quinic properties of the drug in her science class.
meanings.sent3: The quinic smell of the hospital reminded him of his grandmother's house.
meanings.sent4: The quinic color of the liquid resembled the bark of a tree.
meanings.sent5: The quinic flavor lingered on her tongue long after she swallowed the pill.

meanings.definition: A crystalline acid obtained from cinchona bark.
meanings.sent1: The quinic was extracted from the bark to make the medicine.
meanings.sent2: He learned about the benefits of quinic in his chemistry research.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled the quinic all over the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: The quinic sparkled under the microscope like tiny crystals.
meanings.sent5: The quinic was a key ingredient in the ancient remedy for malaria.
